title: Judging Effectiveness Of Airstrikes Against ISIS Remains Challenging
teaser: The Obama administration's strategy against ISIS is fraying, according to U.S. officials. The bombing strikes are too small and dispersed, leading to a charge that they are "Shock and Yawn," a play on the "Shock and Awe" bombing campaign of the Iraq War.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
